title: Practice-Centered Problem-Solving Programming Intensive Course

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Computer Literacy and Logical Reasoning Experience
context.additional_context: Small-group settings enabling personalized feedback, emphasizing practice-based on real-world cases

learning_goals: Analyze given practical problems and convert them into pseudocode.
Learners implement three given algorithms (linear search, binary search, bubble sort) using Python within one week and submit debugged code that passes at least four out of five provided test cases.
Document and present logical problem-solving processes through team-based projects.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
